snippet: An Afghan official said that the strike came during an operation to arrest drug smugglers in Helmand Province on Sunday, and that four officers were also wounded.
abstract: Afghan officials say United States airstrike killed at least 11 narcotics officers in Helmand Province; US military denies any airstrike took place.

byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND and MUJIB MASHAL
byline.contributor: Taimoor Shah contributed reporting from Kandahar, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: An Afghan official said that the strike came during an operation to arrest drug smugglers in Helmand Province on Sunday, and that four officers were also wounded.

headline.main: U.S. Denies an Airstrike Killed 11 Afghan Narcotics Officers
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; Afghanistan: Narcotics Officers Die in Airstrike That Some Attribute to U.S.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
